articles.author: Reade Levinson, Feras Dalatey
articles.description: More than 1,000 Syrians died in detention at a military airport on the outskirts of Damascus, killed by execution, torture or maltreatment at a site that was widely feared, according to a report to be published Thursday tracing the deaths to seven suspected grave sites.
articles.title: Exclusive: More than 1,000 Syrians died in airport prison under Assad, report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gene Hackman, the intense character actor who won two Oscars in a more than 60-year career, has died alongside his wife, pianist Betsy Arakawa, and their dog at home, the sheriff's office in Santa Fe, New Mexico, said.
articles.title: Actor Gene Hackman and wife found dead alongside dog at home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Militant group Hamas said it was ready to begin talks on the second phase of a ceasefire in Gaza after several hundred Palestinians were released from Israeli jails overnight in return for the bodies of four Israeli hostages.
articles.title: Hamas says it's ready for more ceasefire talks after prisoner exchange

articles.author: Daren Butler
articles.description: Turkey's jailed militant leader Abdullah Ocalan called on his Kurdistan Workers Party to lay down its arms, a move that could end its 40-year conflict with Ankara and have far-reaching political and security consequences for the region.
articles.title: Jailed Kurdish militant leader calls for end to conflict with Turkey

articles.author: Andreas Rinke, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Hours after Friedrich Merz's conservatives won Germany's national election, he sent the outgoing Social Democrat government a memorandum dictating how to cooperate during the transition period before he took power.
articles.title: German poll winner Merz's abrasive style could hamper coalition building

articles.author: Wendell Roelf, Leika Kihara
articles.description: A meeting of finance ministers and central bankers from the Group of 20 nations failed on Thursday to come up with a joint communique, with a "chair's summary" issued by the South African host reiterating a commitment to resisting protectionism.
articles.title: G20 finance meeting fails to agree joint communique

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Alexandra Ulmer, Aram Roston
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump’s top aides are struggling to contain disputes at the White House and across the administration following billionaire Elon Musk's ultimatum to federal workers to list their accomplishments or lose their jobs, said three government officials familiar with the tensions.
articles.title: Ultimatum to federal workers raises tensions between Musk, White House staff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Explosions at a rally held by M23 rebels in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo city of Bukavu killed 11 people and wounded 65 others, Corneille Nangaa, head of the rebel alliance that includes M23, said in a press conference on Thursday.
articles.title: Blasts at M23 rally in eastern Congo kill 11, wound 65, rebel leader says

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, a right-winger kept at arms length by Washington under former President Joe Biden, will meet U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent in Washington next Wednesday, Smotrich's spokesman said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli Finance Minister Smotrich to meet US Treasury secretary next week

articles.author: Jonathan Spicer
articles.description: Turkey's 40-year battle against the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) could be nearing an end after its jailed leader, Abdullah Ocalan, called on the militant group on Thursday to lay down its arms and disband.
articles.title: Ocalan's call for peace in Turkey: what's in it for key actors?
